item.title: 宝马呼吁达成跨大西洋协议以防止关税螺旋式上升
item.description: 德国汽车制造商宝马（BMW）周四发表声明，回应美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布的新汽车关税，敦促欧盟和美国达成协议，防止贸易冲突升级。【原文：German carmaker BMW on Thursday urged the European Union and United States to strike a deal to prevent a spiralling trade conflict, in a statement issued in response to President Donald Trump's announcement of new car tariffs.】

item.title: 解说员：俄罗斯逮捕亿万富翁莫什科维奇事件详情如何？
item.description: 俄罗斯检察官周四要求法官以涉嫌大规模欺诈罪对该国顶级农业公司 Rusagro 的创始人、亿万富翁瓦迪姆-莫什科维奇（Vadim Moshkovich）进行审前拘留。【原文：Russian prosecutors asked a judge on Thursday to put billionaire Vadim Moshkovich, founder of the country's top agriculture company Rusagro, in pre-trial detention on suspicion of large-scale fraud.】

item.title: H&M 首席执行官称美国关税将使美国消费者蒙受损失
item.description: 快速时尚零售商 H&M 公司首席执行官周四表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普提高进口关税的行动将推高美国消费者的消费价格，该公司正在转变供应链以适应新的贸易壁垒。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's actions to raise import tariffs will drive prices up for American consumers, the CEO of fast-fashion retailer H&M said on Thursday, as the company shifts its supply chain to adapt to new trade barriers.】

item.title: 独家新闻特朗普政府指示间谍卫星机构监视美墨边境
item.description: 作为全面打击非法移民和贩毒集团行动的一部分，特朗普政府已指示两家情报机构在美墨边境地区训练卫星监控能力。【原文：The Trump administration has directed two intelligence agencies to train their satellite surveillance capabilities on the U.S.-Mexico border region as part of a sweeping crackdown on illegal immigration and drug cartels.】

item.title: 独家报道特朗普政府指示间谍卫星机构监视美墨边境
item.description: 作为全面打击非法移民和贩毒集团行动的一部分，特朗普政府已指示两家情报机构在美墨边境地区训练卫星监控能力。【原文：The Trump administration has directed two intelligence agencies to train their satellite surveillance capabilities on the U.S.-Mexico border region as part of a sweeping crackdown on illegal immigration and drug cartels.】

item.title: 巴西认为贸易紧张局势未见好转先见恶化
item.description: 巴西外贸部长周四警告说，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）提出的美国关税可能会加剧全球贸易紧张局势，而这种紧张局势在好转之前很可能会恶化。【原文：Brazil's Secretary of Foreign Trade warned on Thursday that the global trade tensions being ratcheted up by Donald Trump's U.S. tariffs were likely to get worse before they get better.】

item.title: 高管称美国银行第一季度房贷申请猛增 80
item.description: 美国银行消费者贷款主管表示，1 月至 3 月间，抵押贷款申请激增了 80%，原因是购房者受到房屋库存增加和长期债券收益率下降的诱惑。【原文：Bank of America saw an 80% jump in mortgage applications between January and March, its executive of consumer lending said, as buyers were tempted by increasing home inventory and lower long-term bond yield.】

item.title: 条款表显示，中国电动汽车制造商新奥将为电动汽车开发融资 4.5 亿美元
item.description: 据路透社周四查阅的一份条款书显示，中国电动汽车制造商尼奥将通过配股融资约35亿港元（4.501亿美元），用于开发智能电动汽车。 (1美元=7.7763港元）【原文：Chinese electric vehicle maker Nio will raise around HK$3.50 billion ($450.1 million) via a share placement to develop its smart EVs, according to a term sheet reviewed by Reuters on Thursday. ($1 = 7.7763 Hong Kong dollars)】

item.title: 印度加大打击力度，没收亚马逊和 Flipkart 仓库中的产品
item.description: 印度国营产品认证机构表示，本月突击搜查了电商巨头亚马逊和 Flipkart 在德里的仓库，查获了不符合质量控制标准的商品，加强了对这两家公司的审查。【原文：India's state-run product certification agency said it raided the Delhi warehouses of e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart this month, seizing items that did not meet quality control standards, as it increased its scrutiny of the two firms.】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国吉利将整合内部数字驾驶舱系统研发团队
item.description: 一位直接了解情况的消息人士称，中国吉利集团（GEELY.UL）正在将现有的三个单位合并成一个统一的团队，这三个单位拥有近 2000 名工程师，负责开发数字驾驶舱系统。【原文：China's Geely Group (GEELY.UL) is merging three existing units employing nearly 2,000 engineers to develop digital cockpit systems into a single unified team, said a source with direct knowledge of the situation.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚官员称美国有望再次豁免对石油公司 NIS 的制裁
item.description: 塞尔维亚国家天然气公司（Srbijagas）首席执行官周四表示，由俄罗斯天然气工业石油公司（Gazprom Neft）和俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（Gazprom）控股的塞尔维亚国家石油公司（NIS）很可能在最后一刻将其免受美国制裁的期限延长30天。【原文：Serbian oil company NIS , majority-owned by Russia's Gazprom Neft and Gazprom , is likely to get a last-minute, 30-day extension to its waiver from U.S. sanctions, the CEO of state gas company Srbijagas said on Thursday.】

item.title: 英国监管机构因 OnlyFans 运营商年龄披露失误罚款 140 万美元
item.description: 英国媒体和电信监管机构周四表示，已对成人网站和社交媒体平台 OnlyFans 的运营商处以 105 万英镑（140 万美元）的罚款，原因是该公司在年龄披露方面存在失误。【原文：Britain's media and telecommunications regulator said on Thursday it has fined the operator of OnlyFans, an adults-only website and social media platform, 1.05 million pounds ($1.4 million) over disclosure failures related to age.】

item.title: 共和党人在削减开支问题上意见分歧，他们试图为特朗普的减税政策买单
item.description: 美国国会共和党人正在为如何支付唐纳德-特朗普总统数万亿美元的减税和移民改革议程而苦苦挣扎，医疗补助计划和国家债务上限的命运也悬而未决。【原文：U.S. congressional Republicans are struggling over how to pay for President Donald Trump's multi-trillion-dollar tax-cut and immigration reform agenda, with the fate of the Medicaid healthcare program and the nation's debt ceiling hanging in the balance.】

item.title: 零部件供应商博世称汽车关税下仍看好北美市场
item.description: 德国汽车零部件供应商博世（ROBG.UL）在一份回应美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布加征关税的声明中表示，博世仍在北美地区实施扩张计划，同时强调博世的全球定位。【原文：German car parts supplier Bosch (ROBG.UL) said it is still banking on the North American region with expansion plans there, while stressing that it was globally positioned in a statement responding to U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff announcement.】

item.title: 特朗普政府要求石油和生物燃料组织制定新的生物燃料政策
item.description: 据四位熟知内情的人士透露，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的政府已要求石油和生物燃料生产商就下一阶段的国家生物燃料政策达成协议，以避免出现他第一任期内的那种政治冲突。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's administration has asked oil and biofuels producers to hash out a deal on the next phase of the nation's biofuels policy to avoid the kind of political clashes that marked his first term, according to four people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 在机构动荡之际，特朗普领导市场监督机构的人选面临参议院选举
item.description: 保罗-阿特金斯（Paul Atkins）是前华尔街监管者，唐纳德-特朗普总统已任命他管理美国证券交易委员会，他将于周四在参议院确认听证会上作证，而此时正值美国证券交易委员会和整个联邦工作人员队伍发生重大变化之际。【原文：Paul Atkins, a former Wall Street regulator whom President Donald Trump has tapped to run the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, is set to testify at a Senate confirmation hearing on Thursday at a time of major change at the agency and across the federal workforce.】

item.title: 聚焦：银行老板呼吁放宽规则，特朗普提名的监管机构倾听呼声
item.description: 美国银行业巨头正在推动唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府出台一系列更宽松的法规，并表示监管机构正在倾听的信号令他们感到振奋。【原文：U.S. banking giants are pushing for a swath of lighter regulations from President Donald Trump's administration, and say they are heartened by signals that regulators are listening.】

item.title: 经济动荡冲击美国航空公司，旅游需求萎靡不振
item.description: 不到两个月前，美国的航空公司还在谈论新的黄金时代，因为强劲的旅行需求和全行业紧张的运力带来了多年盈利繁荣的前景。【原文：U.S. airlines were flying high less than two months ago on talk of a new golden age, as strong travel demand and tight industry-wide capacity raised the prospect of a multi-year profit boom.】

item.title: 聚焦：顶级油田旌旗招展，美国石油生产商面临新挑战
item.description: 随着美国第一大油田逐渐老化，水和天然气产量增加，石油产量减少，美国石油生产商正在努力应对产量增长的地质限制--产量可能已接近峰值。【原文：U.S. oil producers are grappling with geological limits to production growth as the country's top oilfield ages and produces more water and gas and less oil - and may be nearing peak output.】

item.title: 欧盟法院顾问支持 WhatsApp 对抗欧盟隐私监管机构
item.description: Meta Platforms 旗下的 WhatsApp 周四在与欧盟隐私监管机构的斗争中获得了欧洲最高法院顾问的支持，该机构四年前曾因爱尔兰数据保护机构侵犯隐私而下令对其处以高额罚款。【原文：Meta Platforms' WhatsApp on Thursday got the backing of an adviser to Europe's top court in its fight against the EU privacy watchdog, which had ordered the Irish data protection authority to jack up a fine four years ago for privacy breaches.】

item.title: 特朗普加征关税后汽车股下滑，华尔街期货走势低迷
item.description: 追踪华尔街主要股指的期货周四表现低迷，其中汽车股在唐纳德-特朗普总统发出最新关税信号后将扩大跌幅。【原文：Futures tracking Wall Street's main indexes were subdued on Thursday, with auto stocks set to extend losses after President Donald Trump's latest tariff salvo.】

item.title: 商会称贸易壁垒不断增加阻碍德国企业发展
item.description: 德国商会 DIHK 周四的一项调查显示，保护主义倾向正在使德国企业的对外业务复杂化，尤其是在美国，并推迟了出口的复苏。【原文：Protectionist tendencies are complicating foreign business for German companies particularly in the United States and postponing a recovery in exports, a survey by the German chamber of commerce DIHK showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 法国汽车游说团 PFA：贸易战只会有输家
item.description: 法国汽车游说团 PFA 周四表示，美欧之间迫在眉睫的贸易战只会有输家【原文：The French car lobby PFA said on Thursday that there can only be losers in the looming trade war between the United States and Europe】

item.title: 欧洲央行称密切关注银行流动性，与美联储合作良好
item.description: 欧洲央行首席监管官克劳迪娅-布赫（Claudia Buch）周四在被问及对美联储承诺提供美元资金的担忧时表示，欧洲央行监管机构 "非常密切地 "关注银行的流动性，并将继续与美联储的同事保持良好的合作关系。【原文：European Central Bank supervisors watch banks' liquidity "very closely" and continue to work well with their Federal Reserve colleagues, the ECB's chief regulator Claudia Buch said on Thursday when asked about worries concerning the Fed's commitment to providing U.S. dollar funding.】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国国家主席习近平将会见宝马、奔驰和高通公司首席执行官
item.description: 两位消息人士周四透露，德国汽车制造商宝马和奔驰以及芯片巨头高通公司的全球负责人将于本周与中国国家主席习近平会面。【原文：The global heads of German automakers BMW and Mercedes , as well as chip giant Qualcomm are among foreign business leaders due to meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping this week, two sources said on Thursday.】

item.title: 法雷奥将因特朗普对汽车进口征收 25% 的关税而提价
item.description: 法国汽车供应商法雷奥发言人周四表示，法雷奥将无法承受特朗普对美国进口汽车征收的25%关税。【原文：Valeo will not be able to absorb Trump's 25% tariffs on car imports to the United States, a spokesperson for the French automotive supplier said on Thursday.】

item.title: 印度 Axis 银行和摩根大通为客户推出随时美元支付服务
item.description: 印度阿克西斯银行（Axis Bank）与摩根大通（J.P. Morgan）合作，为该国的商业客户提供实时美元支付功能，该功能由总部位于美国的贷款机构区块链和数字资产部门 Kinexys 提供。【原文：India's Axis Bank has partnered with J.P. Morgan to offer real-time U.S. dollar payment capabilities to commercial clients in the country, facilitated by Kinexys, the U.S-based lender's blockchain and digital assets unit.】

item.title: 独家报道需求激增，中国 H3C 警告英伟达 AI 芯片短缺
item.description: 在路透社看到的一份客户通知中，中国最大的服务器制造商之一华三通信公司（H3C）指出了英伟达（Nvidia）H20 芯片的潜在短缺问题，该芯片是根据美国出口管制在国内合法供应的最先进的人工智能处理器。【原文：One of China’s largest server makers, H3C, has flagged potential shortages of Nvidia's H20 chip, the most advanced AI processor legally available domestically under U.S. export controls, in a client notice seen by Reuters.】

item.title: SiCarrier称其工具可帮助中国制造先进芯片
item.description: 中国一家主要供应商的一位高管周四表示，中国可以利用本国开发的工具制造先进的半导体，以应对美国对中国获取高端芯片制造技术的限制。【原文：China can use domstically developed tools to make advanced semiconductors, countering U.S. curbs on Beijing's access to high-end chipmaking technology, an executive at a major Chinese supplier said on Thursday.】

item.title: 下一位首席执行官的十亿英镑里程碑引发继任担忧
item.description: 英国服装零售商 Next 于本周四加入了盈利 10 亿英镑的俱乐部，但在投资者庆祝的同时，他们也开始担心该公司已任职 24 年的明星首席执行官西蒙-沃尔夫森（Simon Wolfson）缺乏明确的继任计划。【原文：British clothing retailer Next joined the one billion-pound profit club on Thursday, but while investors celebrate, they are also starting to worry about the lack of a clear succession plan for its star CEO of 24 years Simon Wolfson.】
